timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Procureur d'office for dean and chapter of St. Dié asks for arrest and investigation due to public clamour and accusation by Jean Jacquemin of Develines

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Interrogation and confrontations; no progress made, simple denials

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for question ordinaire

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews on hands and feet, then racked; confessed after lunch break when threatened with further torture

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Two interrogations; provided additional names of accomplices

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Procureur of Chapter asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Antoine asks to be brought before judges; initially appears repentant, then completely retracts confession, denies being at sabbat or seeing anyone there

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Prévôt of Saint-Dié says he cannot proceed to execution without formal order from duke or Change de Nancy due to retraction; maire protests

timeline.subject: Antoine Didier Valdexey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy declares execution should proceed despite retraction; signed by 5 judges

prior_accusations.context: accused Antoine Didier Valdexey of having been at sabbat with him; Jean Jacquemin currently held prisoner at Anould
had called him and his wife witches; accused obtained reparation by justice

notable_quotes.speaker: Germaine veuve de Mengel le Compain
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne la plaidoyeroit pour cela, mais qu'il l'auroit bien d'autre facon
notable_quotes.english: that he would not sue her for it, but that he would get it another way
notable_quotes.context: Threat after she refused to allow him to build wall on land belonging to her children

notable_quotes.speaker: accused's wife (via Claude Vincent)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle luy avoit caché beaucoup de ses meschancetés, mais qu'elle ne luy en sascheroit plus tant, et voudroit que desià il fut mort et enterré
notable_quotes.english: that she had hidden many of his wickednesses from him, but that she would no longer hide them so much, and wished that he were already dead and buried
notable_quotes.context: Wife's reported statement about the accused

notable_quotes.speaker: Antoine Didier Valdexey
notable_quotes.french: que ce fut une mauvaise pensée qui luy vint en teste, et luy faisoit croire qu'il estoit bon chrestien, et avoit trop dit
notable_quotes.english: that it was a bad thought that came into his head, and made him believe that he was a good Christian, and had said too much
notable_quotes.context: When asked if he wanted to deny earlier confessions on July 14

notable_quotes.speaker: Antoine Didier Valdexey
notable_quotes.french: qu'il n'a veu personne au sabat, et n'y fut jamais, et n'est sorcier, et le maintiendra tousjours, et du reste que l'on face de luy ce que l'on voudra
notable_quotes.english: that he had seen no one at the sabbat, and was never there, and is not a witch, and will always maintain this, and for the rest let them do with him what they will

notable_quotes.speaker: Antoine Didier Valdexey (reported by witness 5)
notable_quotes.context: His response when asked if her husband was still at the mill, shortly before husband was found dead under the wheel

economic_context.details: Multiple property and debt disputes: dispute over meadow rent, debt of 6 gros for daughter keeping animals, dispute over lease of meadow belonging to children, dispute over wall construction on widow's children's land. Accused worked as day labourer and carpenter, suggesting lower economic status. Wife and cousin warned him of impending arrest.

extraction_metadata.notes: Document provides comprehensive detail on witness testimony, timeline, and legal proceedings. Notable features: (1) Accused completely retracted confession on July 14, denying sabbat attendance and naming accomplices, after initially confessing under torture on July 2. (2) Change de Nancy ruled execution should proceed despite retraction. (3) Multiple property/debt disputes evident. (4) Witness 12 mentions alleged bestiality incident from 30+ years earlier, and was offered payment to publicly call accused 'un fotteur de vache' but refused. (5) Wife repeatedly mentioned as co-suspect who warned accused and allegedly told him to stay silent if arrested. (6) Economic status inferred as 'poor' based on: day labourer work, carpentry, debt disputes (6 gros), tuteur role for minors suggesting some community standing but overall pattern of lower-status work. (7) Accused obtained legal redress against Pierron Urbain for defamation, showing prior use of legal system. (8) Some uncertainty about identity/relationships of multiple people named 'Jean Gerard' - may be same person or different people. (9) Date of initial accusation by Jean Jacquemin uncertain ('? June 1615').
